dcterms:description: This dataset examines the unintended consequences of reserve design in Boston's walk zones, focusing on the implications for school choice mechanisms.
dcterms:title: Reserve design: Unintended consequences and the demise of Boston’s walk zones

dcterms:creator: U. Dur
P. A. Pathak
T. Sönmez
dcterms:description: This dataset provides evidence from Chicago’s exam schools regarding explicit versus statistical targeting in affirmative action policies.
dcterms:title: Explicit vs. statistical targeting in affirmative action: Theory and evidence from Chicago’s exam schools

dcterms:creator: O. Aygun
I. Bó
dcterms:description: This dataset analyzes college admissions with multidimensional privileges, focusing on the Brazilian affirmative action case.
dcterms:title: College admission with multidimensional privileges: The Brazilian affirmative action case

T. Sönmez

dcterms:description: This dataset explores the fair allocation of vaccines, ventilators, and antiviral treatments, emphasizing ethical values in healthcare rationing.
dcterms:title: Fair allocation of vaccines, ventilators and antiviral treatments: leaving no ethical value behind in health care rationing

dcterms:creator: M. Akbarpour
E. B. Budish

dcterms:description: This dataset presents an economic framework for vaccine prioritization, addressing the allocation of scarce medical resources.
dcterms:title: An economic framework for vaccine prioritization

dcterms:creator: A. Grigoryan
dcterms:description: This dataset discusses effective, fair, and equitable pandemic rationing, providing insights into resource allocation during health crises.
dcterms:title: Effective, fair and equitable pandemic rationing
